channel.title: linux on Nothing in Particular
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Nothing in Particular

item.title: Why aren't you using WSL
item.description: A few years ago Microsoft shipped an experimental feature in their insider builds called the Windows Subsystem for Linux, which is a bizarrely named thing that runs Linux natively from within Windows. To nitpick a bit, it doesn’t strictly run Linux as in the kernel, but it does run the userspace applications. And it’s not really a Windows-like subsystem for Linux, it’s more of a Linux subsystem for Windows, but it’s difficult to pronounce “LSW”.
